comments.body: Just curious... what does the Node install and then `npm install` in the `bokehjs` dir? BokehJS has to be built from coffeescript sources.
which also means you probably want `python setup.py install --build-js`

> Added you here @almarklein. :smile:

I suspect @bryevdv also wants to be on this list ;)
I have more than enough on my plate I am happy to spectate here

> Just curious... what does the Node install and then npm install in the bokehjs dir? BokehJS has to be built from coffeescript sources.

If you are getting the source from pypi, there is no need for node steps... All the necessary JS and CSS should be there in the tar.gz package.

In this case they are building from our sources, not from scratch... which I think it is a reasonable approach...

> I have more than enough on my plate I am happy to spectate here

Honestly, when asking devs to sign up as maintainers, this is sort of what I'm hoping for basically. The exact points that you have raised here about how to properly build the package are what I want to know. So, if I do something silly, someone who knows the codebase better can point it out to me. If either of you would be willing to that @bryevdv @damianavila, then I would be more than happy to add you here.

> In this case they are building from our sources, not from scratch... which I think it is a reasonable approach...

Yeah, I was thinking about building from scratch, but wasn't ready to dive through the dependency tree on a first pass. Though, in the long run, I'd like to explore it in the feedstock.

Was getting the source from PyPI @bryevdv in the assumption that the Coffescript was already compiled and included for a first pass. However, it seems the JS and Coffescript for that matter are not present in the PyPI. Might be worth investigating.

Stop giving me heart attacks :)
